spirals.title: ISO-1 for Data Discovery - Mandatory
spirals.description: This spiral includes mandatory ISO 19115-1 attributes for data discovery. This list of attributes was obtained from table F.1 of the ISO 19115-1 Specification.

items.name: Resource Title
items.description: A short description of the resource. The title should be descriptive enough so that when a user is presented with a list of titles the general content of the data set can be determined.

items.name: Abstract
items.note: This concept is called Desciption in Catalog Services for the Web.

items.name: Modified Date
items.description: Date on which the metadata record (not the resource) was created or updated within the catalogue.

items.name: Metadata Contact
items.description: The organization or person currently responsible for the metadata.

items.name: Bounding Box
items.note: This concept is called Coverage in the CSW Specification
items.description: A bounding box for identifying a geographic area of interest

items.name: Topic Category
items.description: High level category enumeration used in ISO

spirals.title: ISO-1 for Data Discovery - Conditional
spirals.description: This spiral includes conditional ISO 19115-1 attributes for data discovery. This list of attributes was obtained from table F.1 of the ISO 19115-1 Specification.

items.name: Resource Type
items.description: A resource code identifying the type of resource; e.g. dataset, a collection, an application (See MD_ScopeCode) for which the metadata describes.

spirals.title: ISO-1 for Data Discovery - Optional
spirals.description: This spiral includes optional ISO 19115-1 attributes for data discovery. This list of attributes was obtained from table F.1 of the ISO 19115-1 Specification.

items.name: Metadata Identifier
items.description: A phrase or string which uniquely identifies the metadata file/record.

items.name: Theme Keyword
items.note: The general identification keywords usually have a type of theme and are refered to as theme keywords. Other types and vocabularies are used for other information. Service Entry Resource Format (SERF) requires a Science and a Service GCMD Keyword. This concept is called Subject in the CSW Specification.
items.description: A word or phrase that describes some aspect of a resource. Can be one of several types.

items.name: Resource Creation/Revision Date
items.description: The date the resource was created

items.name: Resource Identifier
items.description: Identifier for the resource described by the metadata

items.name: Resource Contact
items.description: The organization or person responsible for answering questions about the resource.

items.name: Spatial Resolution
items.description: The nominal scale and/or spatial resolution of the resource.

items.name: Temporal Extent
items.description: The temporal extent of the resource

items.name: Vertical Extent
items.description: The vertical extent of the resource

items.name: Resource Lineage
items.description: A description of the source(s) and production process(es) used in producing the resource.

items.name: Resource on-line Link
items.description: Online link referencing additional information about the resource.

items.name: Metadata Use Constraints
items.description: Information about how the data may or may not be used after access is granted to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, terms and conditions, and/or limitations on using the data set. Data providers may request acknowledgement of the data from users and claim no responsibility for quality and completeness of data.
